quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Sport and Sports
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, blake, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1984, who became the first American ever to win the all-around title at the Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Lou Retton

questions.question: What two gymnasts tied for the uneven bar gold at the 2003 World Gymnastics Championships?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hollie Vise and Chellesie Memmel

questions.question: Which of the following gymnasts was not on the 2004 US Olympic Gymnastics team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shannon Miller

questions.question: Chula and Pakpao are very popular in Thailand. Which statement best describes them?

options.text: They are forms of kite fighting.
They are forms of gymnastics native to Thailand.
They are forms of mixed martial arts taught in Thailand and derived from Chinese style  kung fu.
They are forms of kick boxing developed in Thailand (Siam).

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are forms of kite fighting.

questions.question: Which of these sports is not a form of basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Penague

questions.question: Kadima is a paddle sport in which the object is to cooperate with another person and see how many times you can hit a ball to each other without it hitting the ground. Where was this sport developed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Israel

questions.question: In 1954 Alan Blake of Southsea, England invented octopush which is an underwater form of hockey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Paul and Morgan Hamm made history in 2000 for which of these?

options.text: Being the first brothers ever to compete together in the Olympics
Being the youngest people ever to compete in the Olympics
Being the first set of twins to compete for USA in Gymnastics
They did not make history in 2000, as did not start competing until 2001

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Being the first set of twins to compete for USA in Gymnastics

questions.question: How many medals did the Gymnastics US team get in the 2004 Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: Although this sport originated in Cypress Gardens, Florida, it was further developed by Australians. The sport has three categories: tricks, jumping and slalom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barefoot waterskiing

questions.question: In 1961Ludwig von Bersuda was looking for a game that would also be a good conditioning sport. What sport did he invent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Underwater rugby

questions.question: Who is the 2005 Womens Sr. National Gymnastics Champion in the all-around?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nastia Liukin

questions.question: Shannon Miller was the first American gymnast ever to win an indivdual gold medal at a non-boycotted games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the 1970s the Swiss biologist Hermann Brandt developed a sport which would depend on  teamwork and would not involve the terrible injuries that are so common in other sports. What sport did he invent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tchoukball

questions.question: Who was the first gymnast ever to score a perfect 10.0?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nadia Comaneci

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Year and Daytona
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, jimmy, hours. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Was Jimmy Rollins the everyday shortstop for the 2008 Philadelphia Phillies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Ayrton Senna died on May 1st, 1994 while racing in the San Marino Grand Prix at Imola for Williams. What team did Ayrton Senna start his Formula One career with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toleman

questions.question: Is Pat the Bat Burrell a right fielder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In NASCAR Nextel Cup Racing there is no event more exciting than the season opener the Daytona 500, held at Daytona International Speedway every February. What trophy is the winner of the Daytona 500 awarded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Harley J. Earl Trophy

questions.question: Arguably the second most important sports car race held in the world is the 24 hours of Daytona. In what year was the inaugural 24 hours of Daytona held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1966

questions.question: Where is outfielder Shane Victorino from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hawaii

questions.question: The inaugural Canadian Grand Prix race (for F1 cars) was held at Mosport Park in Bowmanville, Ontario approximately 70 miles northeast of Toronto, in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1967

questions.question: The inaugural Indianapolis 500 held in 1911 was won by Ray Harroun driving a Marmon “Wasp”. What was his average winning speed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 74.602 mph

questions.question: How many saves did Brad Lidge finish the regular 2008 season with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 41

questions.question: The Monaco Grand Prix is the crown jewel of Formula One. In what year was the inaugural race run?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1929

questions.question: The 24 Hours of Le Mans has been held almost every year since 1923. The race was cancelled from 1940 to 1948 due to WWII and in what other year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1936

questions.question: Gilles Villeneuve was granted a Formula 1 seat after impressing a fellow driver during a non-championship Formula Atlantic race in 1977. Who did Gilles Villeneuve impress to get his first ride in Formula one with McLaren?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Hunt

questions.question: The Indianapolis Motor Speedway is known to many fans as “The Brickyard” because it was once surfaced with 3.2 million bricks which replaced its original surface to make it safer for racing. What was the Speedway originally surfaced with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crushed rock and Tar

questions.question: First baseman Ryan Howard was the 2006 MVP.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What year was the first F1 US Grand Prix held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1959

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Shawn Michaels and Brett Michaels
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, yankees, stadium. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What song, written by Jimmy Hart, is Shawn Michaels entrance music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sexy Boy

questions.question: What is the name of Shawn Michaels second wife whom he married in 1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rebecca

questions.question: Where did Shawn Michaels grow up?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Antonio, TX.

questions.question: What is the name of the second baseman of the 2008 Philadelphia Phillies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chase Utley

questions.question: Did the tag team The Rockers consist of Shawn Michaels and Brett Michaels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Where did the Yankees play immediately before Yankee Stadium was built?

options.text: Oriole Park-the home of the Baltimore Orioles
Shea Stadium-the home of the New York Mets
The Polo Grounds-the home of the New York Giants
Ebbets Field-the home of the Brooklyn Dodgers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Polo Grounds-the home of the New York Giants

questions.question: Did Jason Werth come off the bench and hit a home run during the 2008 playoffs with the Dodgers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Brett Michaels and Shawn Michaels are brothers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Did the Flying Hawaiian hit a home run in the 2008 game against the Milwaukee Brewers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Name the oldest pitcher of the 2008 Philadelphia Phillies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jamie Moyer

questions.question: How many brothers does Shawn Michaels have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: What is Shawn Michaels real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Shawn Hickenbottom

questions.question: When did Shawn Michaels win his first WWE Championship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1996

questions.question: What is Shawn Michaels finishing move?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweet Chin Music

questions.question: What statement concerning Shawn Michaels children is true?

options.text: His son was born in 2000 and his daughter was born in 2004.
His daughter was born in 2000 and his daughter was born in 2004.
His son was born in 1998 and his daughter was born in 2008.
His son was born in 2005 and his daughter was born in 2003.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His son was born in 2000 and his daughter was born in 2004.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Yankee Stadium and Land
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, yankees. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On June 22, 1938 a famous boxing match was held in Yakee Stadium. Who lost?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Max Schmelling

questions.question: Who owned the Yankees when Yankee Stadium was built?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacob Ruppert and Tullinghast LHommedieu

questions.question: The land where Yankee Stadium was built was previously used for this purpose.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lumber yard

questions.question: On April 18, 1923 Babe Ruth hit the first home run in Yankee Stadium against this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston Red Sox

questions.question: What was the maximum capacity of Yankee Stadium when it was first built?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 71,900

questions.question: Which of the following does not have a monument at Monument Park, a section of Yankee Stadium contains a collection of monuments?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wellington Mara

questions.question: Yankee Stadium had the first instant-replay display in baseball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1957, a large crowd came to hear this man speak at Yankee Stadium.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Graham

questions.question: In the 1970s this professional soccer team played their home games at Yankee Stadium.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cosmos

questions.question: What was the first college football team to win over 50 games at Yankee Stadium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York University

questions.question: Which of the following has never been a nickname for Yankee Stadium?

options.text: The house that was built for Ruth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The house that built baseball

questions.question: Yankee Stadium was the first baseball field to have over 160 post-season games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Find the correct statement about Yankee Stadium.

options.text: Yankee Stadium was always an exclusively baseball field.
The New York Yankees have always played their regular season games at Yankee Stadium.
Yankee Stadiums original name was The New York Yankee Baseball Field.
Yankee Stadium was the first three-tiered sports facility.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yankee Stadium was the first three-tiered sports facility.

questions.question: For many years he made all the announcements at Yankee Stadium.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Sheppard

questions.question: The land on which Yankee Stadium was built was bought for this price.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $675,000

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Game and Perfect Game
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, june, angels. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1968, Catfish Hunter pitched a perfect game for the Oakland Athletics, beating the Minnesota Twins 4 to 0. What is Catfishs real name?

options.text: Catfish Hunter is his real name

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Augustus Hunter

questions.question: On April 30, 1922, Charlie Robertson pitched a perfect game for the Chicago White Sox. What team lost that day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detroit Tigers

questions.question: Who pitched a perfect game for the California Angels on September 30, 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Witt

questions.question: Who was the starting quarterback  for LSU in their 2005 bowl game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matt Flynn

questions.question: In what year did Len Barker pitch a perfect game for the Cleveland Indians, in a 3-0 win against the Toronto Blue Jays?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1981

questions.question: On September 9, 1965, this Hall of Fame Pitcher threw a perfect game against the Chicago Cubs. Who was he and what team did he pitch for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandy Koufax, L.A. Dodgers

questions.question: The second perfect game in the 20th century took place on October 2, 1908 and was pitched by Addie Joss for what team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleveland Naps

questions.question: The first perfect game in the 20th century was pitched on May 5, 1904. Who was the winning pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cy Young

questions.question: What two baseball teams played on July 28, 1991 when Dennis Martinez pitched a perfect game?

options.text: Chicago Cubs and San Francisco Giants
L.A. Dodgers and St. Louis Cardinals

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montreal Expos and L.A. Dodgers

questions.question: David Wells pitched a perfect game for the New York Yankees on May 17, 1998. What team was the loser?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minnesota Twins

questions.question: On June 21, 1964, the Philadelphia Phillies beat the New York Mets 6 to 0 behind a perfect game pitched by this player.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Bunning

questions.question: In 1956, during game 5 of the World Series, the New York Yankees beat the Brooklyn Dodgers 2 to 0 and it took Don Larsen just 97 pitches to complete the game. What catcher caught the game for the Yankees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yogi Berra

questions.question: Kenny Rogers pitched a perfect game for the Texas Rangers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Tom Browning pitched a perfect game on September 16, 1988 for the Cincinnati Reds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What two teams were playing when Randy Johnson pitched a perfect game on May 18, 2004?

options.text: New York Yankees and Boston Red Soxs
Arizona Diamondbacks and the Atlanta Braves
Arizona Diamondbacks and the New York Yankees
Atlanta Braves and the New York Yankees

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arizona Diamondbacks and the Atlanta Braves

questions.question: This 2005 LSU recruit insisted that he was 100 percent committed to Texas, but on National Signing Day he signed with LSU.

questions.question: By ITTF rules, when you serve, the ball must not bounce more than once on the opponents side of the table. If it does, then you lose the point (even though your opponent did not return the serve). This is to ensure that the serve is not so short as to be impossible to retrieve.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
